removals.reasoning: The outer parentheses around the cast expression are redundant; the cast (double*)A already yields an expression suitable as a function argument.
Same as above: the outer parentheses around the cast are unnecessary.
Redundant outer parentheses around the cast in the function call argument.
Redundant outer parentheses around the cast in the function call argument.
Outer parentheses around the cast expression are unnecessary when used as a function argument.
The outer parentheses wrapping the cast are redundant; keep the casts themselves but remove the extra grouping parentheses.
Same as above: the outer grouping parentheses are unnecessary around the cast expression.
Parentheses around the array index expression are redundant; A[index] with the arithmetic expression is clear and has the same meaning.
Parentheses around the array index are unnecessary and can be removed for clarity.
The extra parentheses around the additive/subtractive expression are redundant; arithmetic precedence yields the same result and the expression is still readable.
Subtraction has higher precedence than the relational operator '<', so the parentheses are unnecessary: i < n - 1 is equivalent to i < (n - 1).
Same reasoning as above for the j < (n - 1) condition.
Array indexing with an arithmetic expression does not require an extra pair of parentheses around the index.
Remove redundant parentheses around the array index; the arithmetic expression is clear without them.
The inner grouping around the sub-expression is unnecessary because the arithmetic operators' precedence and associativity already produce the intended result.
Nested parentheses around addition are redundant; addition is left-associative and the expression remains unambiguous without them.
The outer parentheses around the entire index are redundant. The inner parentheses around (1 + i) must remain because they change the order of operations; only the outer grouping can be removed.
Remove the outer grouping; keep (i - 1) to preserve the needed order before multiplication.
The parentheses around this numeric expression passed as a function argument are unnecessary; num_blocks(n - 2, ...) is equivalent and clearer.
Same as the previous occurrence: the cast/grouping is redundant in the function call argument.
The outer parentheses around the cast expression are redundant. Preferred, clearer style is (uint8_t*)&grid_copy — keep the cast but remove the extra grouping parentheses.
Same pattern: remove the redundant outer grouping; keep the cast.
Outer grouping parentheses around the cast are unnecessary and can be removed for conciseness.
Remove redundant outer parentheses around the cast expression.
Same redundant outer grouping around cast as earlier memcpy calls; remove it.
Remove redundant outer parentheses around the cast expression.
Remove unnecessary outer grouping around the cast.
Remove redundant outer parentheses around the cast expression for clarity.
Parentheses around a simple identifier used as a function argument are unnecessary.
Array index does not need extra parentheses around the whole expression; removing them improves readability.
Parentheses around an identifier passed to fprintf are redundant and can be removed.
Same as above: the extra parentheses are unnecessary.
